title: Incomplete series (Eclipse)
description:
The ECUP, in an act of finality, drives off a cliff while tonsil-boxing Geena Davis and Susan Sarandon, with 'Eclipse Comics - Incompletes'!

Well, here we are. The last(?) Eclipse upload. This torrent is comprised of series where I found some issues but not all of them. 

WARNING TO OCD PEOPLE: THESE SERIES ARE INCOMPLETE!!!

Here's a list of the series included within:

Akihiro Yamada's Lost Continent
Area 88
Axel Pressbutton
Black Magic
Bullet Crow, Fowl of Fortune
Cyber 7 (Books I and II)
Dominion
Fusion
Laser Eraser and Pressbutton
Miracleman Family
New DNAgents
Parts Unknown
Portia Prinz of the Glamazons
Reid Fleming, World's Toughest Milkman
Siegel & Shuster Dateline 1930s
Sun Runners
The Masked Man
The New Wave
The Prowler
The Retaliator
Xenon

(For information on these series, search for them at Grand Comics Database)

After this, going on hiatus for a week or two, spending some time actually READING comics instead of moving them thru cyberspace. But before I go, there's a little business to take care of:

First off, in the style of Marvel's obnoxious one-word teasers, here's some clues to the things I will be uploading after my sabbatical terminates:

DRECK
ELEMENTARY
RESEED
ALLIES
MACHINE

Next up, a PLEA: if anyone happens across any of the missing issues listed in the 'Eclipse Missing.txt' file, feel free to contact me at the enclosed email address and I'll happily do addendums. Or, if you want to upload them yourselves, that's cool too. Getting them back into circulation is the important thing.

And lastly, some kudos:

THANKS SO MUCH to those who helped me plug significant holes in the ECUP: unmanx, binderguy1 (and, by extension, STFmaryville) - I'm looking at you. This 'Incomplete' torrent would have been the largest one without your assistance and advice!

PROPS also to all of you who scoured your collections only to find that you couldn't help. As Woody Allen said, '90% of life is just showing up.' You did indeed show up and I appreciate your efforts.

MUCH, MUCH LOVE to everyone who commented and encouraged! This was a long, laborious process - searching, accessing, amassing, assimilating, checking, reviewing, torrenting, researching, writing intros - and your acknowledgement of my efforts definitely helped me keep going.

PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE! Keep the torrents alive for future generations of comics fans!

And now, with a demonstrative, end-of-game-show air-kiss, I say once again: Thank you, creative teams! Thank you, scanners! Get it, seed it!!!!
